text: In 2 French Canadian sibs who were genotypically male with a female phenotype resulting from combined partial 17-alpha-hydroxylase/17,20-lyase deficiency (202110), Laflamme et al. (1996) identified a homozygous C-to-T transition in exon 1 of the CYP17A1 gene, resulting in an arg96-to-trp (R96W) substitution. Functional expression studies showed that the mutation almost completely abolished the activity of the mutant protein. Laflamme et al. (1996) pointed out that 17-alpha-hydroxylase/17,20-lyase deficiency impairs steroid biosynthesis in the adrenals and gonads; in contrast to congenital adrenal hyperplasia (201910), caused by 21-alpha-hydroxylase or 11-beta-hydroxylase deficiency, in which steroid formation is impaired exclusively in the adrenals
